verb.description: (of a batter) gently tap (a pitched ball) without swinging in an attempt to make it more difficult to field.
examples: the batter tried to bunt the ball down the first baseline
Phil bunted and got to first

verb.description: (of a person or animal) butt with the head or horns.
examples: he bunted her with his head

noun.description: An act or result of bunting a pitched ball.
An act of flying an aircraft in part of an outside loop.

origin: Early 17th century (denoting the puffball fungus): of unknown origin.
